title: ID this Russian prerevolutionary typeface
content:
Here are several examples of an unIDd typeface from early 20th century, from newspaper ads and from a daily planner. It apparently served as the basis for the “Izvestia” newspaper hand-drawn masthead soon after.

Ideas, comrades? Спасибо заранее...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RusKal1_5398.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RusKal2_3828.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RusKal3_3774.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RusKal4_6191.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RusKal5_4317.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RusKal9_3802.jpg)

 [‹ FONT ID HELP.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906/http:/typophile.com/node/50842 "Go to previous forum topic") [Any idea what the BLOCKY typeface is? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906/http:/typophile.com/node/50838 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ivandurakov

comments.content: Herold Reklameschrift. Digital version (by Paratype) is called [Herold Condensed Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103906/http:/paratype.ru/pstore/default.asp?fcode=PT_HRL&letter=H).
